questions.question: Where, in any specific case, different sections of this code specify different materials, methods of construction or other requirements, the most _________ shall govern.
The purpose of this code is to establish __________ requirements to safeguard the public safety, health and general welfare.
Where a referenced code or standard includes sugject matter that is within the scope of the IRC, the provisions of the _____ shall take precedence.
An alternative material or method shall be approved where the proposed design is ______ and complies with the ______ of the code.
Compliance with the specific _______-based provisions of the International Codes in Lieu of specific requirements of the IRC shall be permitted as an alternative.
A permit is not required for one-story detached accessory structures, provided that the floor area does not exceed ______ square feet.
Fences that are _____ feet or less in height do not require a permit.
A permit is not required for the replacement of branch circuit overcurrent devices (breakers) of the required capacity in the same location (within a panel).
Unattached decks not exceeding ______ square feed in area, that are not more than ________ inches above grade at any point, do not require a permit.
questions.note: provided the decks do not serve the exit door required by Section R311.4.

questions.question: Where equipment replacements and repairs must be performed in an emergency situation, the permit application shall be submitted within the _________ _______ business days.
An application for a permit for any proposed work shall be deemed to have been abandoned _______ days after the date of filing.
Before issuing a permit, the building official is ________ to examine or cause to be examined buildings, structures and sites for which an application has been filed.
Where the building official issues a permit, the construction documents shall be approced in writing or by a stamp which states _______ ________ ________ ________.
Final inspection shall be made after the permitted work is ___________ and prior to _______
If located in a flood hazard area, the documentation of elevations required in Section R322,.1.10 shall be submitted to the building offical prior to the ________ inspection.
Signifies access that requires the removal of an access panel or similar removable obstruction.
A finished or unfinished habitable space within an attic.
Hot water is water at a temperature greater than or equal to ________ degrees Fahrenheit.
A wall supporting a vertical load in addition to its own weight is a ________-________ wall.
What is the minimum uniformly distributed live load for habitable attics and attics served with fixed stairs?
Wood structural panels with a minimum thickness of _______ inch and a maximum span of _______ feet shall be permitted for opning protection in windborne debris regions.
The seismic provisions of the IRC apply to detached one- and two-family dwellings in Seismic Design Categories __________.

For dwellings with fire sprinkler systems, exterior walls with a fire seperation distance less than ________ feet shall have not less than a 1-hour fire-resistance rating with exposure from the outside.
In a nonspriklered townhouse building, the common wall between units shall be a minimum of _______ - hour _______ - __________ __________ wall assembly.

For townhouse separation, a parapet is not required where the roof sheathing is fire-retardant-treated wood for a distance of __________ feet on each side of the wall and there are no penetrations in the roof within _________ feet of the common wall.
Openings from a private garage directly into a room used for _______ ________ shall not be permitted.
Doors between the garage and residence shall be equipped with a _____ - ________ ________.
Garages shall be separated from residences and attics by not less than ________ - inch gypsum board or equivalent on the garage side.
Enclosed space under stairs that is accessed by a door or access panel shall have walls, under-stair surface and any soffits protected on the enclosed side with _______ - inch gypsum board.
Wall and ceiling finishes shall have a flame spread index of not greater than ___________.
In combustible construction, fireblocking shall be provided to cut off all concealed draft openings and to form an effective fire barrier between _________.
All habitable rooms shall be provided with aggregate glazing area of not less than ________ percent of the floor area of such rooms.
For natural ventilation for habitable rooms, the minimum openable area to the outdoors shall be ________ percent of the floor area being ventilated.
Bathrooms shall be provided with aggregate glazing area in windows of not less than _______ square feet, one-half of which must be openable.
Where the air infiltration rate of a dwelling unit is not more than _________ air changes per hour where tested, the dwelling unit shall be provided with _______ - ________ mechanical ventilation.
Dwelling units shall be provided with heating facilities capable of maintaining a minimum room temperature of ________ degrees Fahrenheit.
Habitable rooms shall have a floor area of not less than _______ square feet.
Habitable rooms shall be not less than _______ feet in any horizontal dimension.
Habitable space, hallways and portions of basements containing these spaces shall have a ceiling height of not less than _______ feet.
Bathrooms, toilet rooms and aluncdry rooms shall have a minimum ceiling height of _________ feet _______ inches
For rooms with sloped ceilings, at least ______ percent of the required floor area of the room must have a ceiling height of not less than 7 feet.
Portions of basements that do not contain habitable space or hallways shall have a ceiling height of not less than _________ feet ________ inches.
Every dwelling unit shall be provided with a water closet, lavatory, and a ______ or _______.
Each dwelling unit shall be provided with a kitchen area and every kitchen area shall be provided with a _________.
A clearance of at least ________ inches shall be provided at the front of a shower opening.
Showers and bathrubs with installed shower heads shall be finished with a nonabsorbent surface extending to a height of not less than _______ feet above the floor.
Glazing in all fixed and operable panels of swinging, sliding and bifold doors shall be considered a ________ _________.

A pane of glass in a window requires safety glazing if the pane is greater than _______ square feet with a bottom edge less than ________ inches above the floor and a top edge greater than ________ inches above the floor.
Glazing at the side of a stairway where the bottom exposed edge of glazing is less than ________ inches above the plane of the adjacent walking surface must be safety glazing.
Glazing less than _______ inches above the landing at the bottom of the stairway and within ______ inches of the bottom tread nosing must be safety glazing.
Garage floor surfaces shall be of approved _______ material.
Carports shall be open on at least _______ sides.
Basements, habitable attics and every sleeping room shall have at least one operable _______ _______ and ________ __________.
Where emergency escape and rescue openings are provided are provided, they shall have a sill height of not more than ______ inches above the floor.

All emergency escape and rescue openings shall have a minimum net clear opening of ______ square feet. Minimum net clear opening height shall be ______ inches. Minimum net clear opening width shall be ______ inches.

answer.question: The horizontal area of a window well serving an emergency escape and rescue opening shall be not less than ______ square feet.
Window wells serving emergency escape and rescue openings shall be designed for proper ________.
The required egress door for each dwelling unit shall be side-hinged, and shall provide a minimum clear width of ________ inches.
A landing at an exterior door shall have a minimum dimension of _______ inches measured in the direction of travel.
The landing on exterior side of the required egress door is permitted to be a maximum of ______ inches below the top of the threshold provided that the door does not swing over the landing.
The width of a hallway shall be not less than ______ feet.
Where a handrail is installed on one side, the clear width of stairways at handrail height shall be a minimum of ______ inches.
A flight of stairs shall not have a vertical rise larger than _______ inches between floor levels or landings.
There shall be a floor or _________ at the top and bottom of each stairway.
For stairs with a straight run, the landing shall have a minimum depth of ______ inches measured in the direction of travel.
Ramps shall have a maximum slope of _______ unit vertical in _______ units horizontal (8.3-percent slope). where serving the required egress door.
Stairways shall be not less than _______ inches in clear width at all points above the permitted handrail height and below the required headroom height.
Is plastic composite material permitted for use as exterior stair treads?
On stairways, the maximum riser height shall be _______ inches.
On stairways, the minimum tread depth shall be _______ inches.
On stairways, the greatest riser height within any flight of stairs shall not exceed the smallest by more than _______ inch.
On stairways, the greatest tread depth within any flgiht of stairs shall not exceed the smallest by more than _____ inches.
A nosing projection not less than _______ inch and not more than _______ inches shall be provided on stairways.
The headroom in all parts of the stairway shall be not less than _______ feet ________ inches.
On spiral stairways, the minimum width shall be _______ inches. The rise shall be not more than __________ inches between treads. A minimum headroom of ______ feet ______ inches shall be provided.
Handrail height shall be a minimum of ______ inches and a maximum of _______ inches.
Handrails adjacent to a wall shall have a space of not less than _______ inches between the wall and the handrails.
Type I handrails shall have a circular cross section shall have an outside diameter of at least _______ inches and not greater than ______ inches.
Open-sided walking surfaces located more than ______ inches above the floor or grade below shall have guards not less than _______ inches in height.
Required guards shall not have openings from the walking surface to the required guard height that allow passage of a sphere _______ inches in diameter.
An automatic residential fire sprinkler system is not required where ______ or _______ are made to existing townhouses that do not have an automatic residential fire sprinkler system.
Smoke alarms shall be installed in the following locations:
answer: on each additional story of the dwelling

answer.question: Photoelectric smoke alarms shall not be installed less than _______ feet horizontally from a permanently installed cooking appliance.
Required smoke alarms shall receive their primary power from the building wiring, and when primary power is interrupted, shall receive power from a _________.
Physical interconnection of smoke alarms is not required when ________ ________ alarms are installed.
For new construction, an approved carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed in what locations?
Foam plastic shall have a flame spread index of not more than _______ and shall have a smoke-developed index of not more than ________.
Foam plastic shall be separated from the interior of a building by an approved ______ _________ of not less than _______ inch gypsum wallboard.
A thermal barrier is not required for foam plastic insulation in an attic that is entered only for purposes of ________ or _________.
In areas where the probability of termite infestation is "very heavy", the clearance between foam plastics installed above grade and exposed earth shall be at least ______ inches.
Dwelling units in two-family dwellings shall be separated from each other by wall and floor assemblies having not less than _______ -hour fire-resistance rating.
Protection of wood and wood-based products from ________ shall be provided in specified locations by the use of naturally durable wood or wood that is preservative-treated.
Address numbers shall be a minimum of _______ inches high with a minimum stroke width of _______ inch.
Where there are ________ or more dwelling units in a single structure, the accessibility provisions of IBC Chapter 11 for Group R-3 shall apply.
In flood hazard areas, enclosed areas below the design flood elevation shall be used solely for:
Where photovoltaic panels are installed on a roof, a pathway at least _______ inches in width shall be provided to each emergency escape and rescue opening.
The design and consstruction of pools and spas shall comply with the ________.
answer: International Swimming Pool and Spa Code

answer.question: The grade away from foundation walls shall fall minimum of ________ inches within the first ________ feet.

In Seismic Design Categories D0, D1, and D2, foundations with stem walls shall be provided with a minimum of one No. ________ horizontal bar within 12 inches of the top of the wall and one No. _______ horizontal bar located 3 to 5 inches from the bottom of the footing.
All exterior footings shall be placed at least _______ inches below the undisturbed ground surface.
The top surface of footing shall be level. The bottom surface of footings shall not have a slope exceeding _____ unit vertical in ________ units horizontal.
Wood sill plates shall be anchored to the foundation with anchor bolts spaced a maximum of _______ feet on center.
Foundation anchor bolts shall be at least ______ inch in diameter and shall extend a minimum of ________ inches into concrete or grouted cells of concrete masonry units.
Isolated hollow masonry piers shall have a minimum nominal thickness of _______ inches.
Hollow masonry piers shall be capped with ______ inches of solid masonry or concrete or a masonry cap block.
The studs used in wood foundation walls shall be ______-inch by ______-inch members.
Wood sill plates shall be a minimum of _______-inch by _______-inch nominal lumber.
Unless otherwise recommended by the drain manufacturer, perforated foundation drains shall be surrounded with an approved ______ ________.
Steel pipe columns shall be not less than ______ inches in diameter.
In under-floor spaces, the minimum net area of ventilation openings shall be not less than ________ square foot for each ________ square feet of under-floor space area.
Ventilation openings in under-floor spaces are not required where the ground is covered with a continuous ________ vapor retarder and the joints overlap at least _______ inches.
The minimum required floor access opening to all under-floor spaces shall be ______ inches by _______ inches.

Open web truss or I-joint floor assemblies are required to have a ______-inch gypsum wallboard membrane, _______-inch wood structural panel membrane, or equivalent on the underside of the floor framing member.
The ends of each floor joist, beam or girder shall have not less than ______ inches of bearing on wood or metal and not less than ______ inches of bearing on masonry or concrete.
NOtches in solid lumber joists, rafters and beams shall be exceed _______ of the depth, shall not be longer than ________ of the depth and shall not be located in the middle ________ of the span.
The tension side of floor joist members ______ inches or greater in nominal thickness shall not be notched except at the ends of the members.
Where the header joist span does not exceed _______ feet, the header joist may be a single member the same size as the floor joist.

In combustible contruction where there is usable space both above and below a floor-ceiling assembly, draftstops shall be installed so that the area of the concealed space does not exceed ______ square feet.

The provisions of Section R505 Coldformed Steel Floor Framing shall control the construction of cold-formed steel floor framing for buildings not greater than _____ feet in length perpendicular to the joist span.
Flanges and lips of load-bearing cold-formed steel floor framing members shall not be cut or ______.
In cold-formed steel framing, floor cantilevers for the top floor of a two- or three-story building or the first floor of a one-story building shall not exceed _______ inches.
Concrete slab-on-ground floors shall be a minimum of _______ inches thick.
For wood stud walls capped with a double top plate, end joints in top plates shall be offset at least _______ inches.

Where joists, trusses or rafters are spaced more than 16 inches on center and the bearing studs below are spaced 24 inches on center, such members shall bear within _______ inches of the studs beneath.
Any wood stud in an exterior wall or bearing partition may be cut or notched to a depth not exceeding ______ percent of its width.
Wood studs in nonbearing partitions may be notched to a depth not exceeding ______ percent a single stud width.
Exterior wood frame walls parallel to a braced wall line shall be offset not more than ______ feet from the designated braced wall line location.
Braced wall lines greater than 16 feet shall have a minimum of ______ braced wall panels.
Wall bracing Method PFG (Portal frame at garage door opening) is limited to walls supporting a roof or _______ and a ________.
Unfaced fiberglass batt insulation is _______ to be used for fireblocking.
Braced wall panels shall be contructed with intermittent bracing methods and continuous sheathing methods. Mixing bracing methods shall be _________.
In order to use the simplified wall bracing methods, the building must be located where the ultimate design wind speed is less than or equal to _______ mph.

Load-bearing cold-formed steel studs shall be located in-line with joists, trusses and rafters with a maximum tolerance of ______ inch between the centerline of the horizontal and vertical framing members.
Web holes in steel wall studs shall not exceed _______ inches in width or _______ inches in length.
Steel studs and other structural members shall not be _________.
In cold-formed steel framing, king, jack and cripple studs shall be the same dimension and thickness as the adjacent ______ studs.
The minimum thickness of masonry bearing walls more than one story high shall be _______ inches.
Solid masonry walls of one-story dwellings and garages shall be not less than ________ inches in thickness where not greater than 9 feet in height.
Grout shall not be pumped though _______ pipes.
The provisions for structural insulated panel walls are limited to buildings not greater than ______ stories in height with each wall not greater than ____ feet high.
Wood wall framing supporting 3/8 inch gypsum board shall not be spaced more than _______ inches on center.
For a water-resistive barrier on an exterior wall, felt shall be applied horizontally with the upper layer lapped over the lower layer not less than _______ inches.
Anchored stone an masonry veneer installed over a backing of wood or cold-formed steel shall be limited to the first story above grade and shall not exceed _______ inches in thickness.
Masonry veneer above openings shall be supported on lintels of ________ materials.
Where using W1.7 wire ties with hooks, stone or masonry veneer shall be separated from the sheathing by an airspace of a minimum of _______ inch but not more than _______ inches.
Weepholes in masonry veneer shall be not less than _______ inch in diameter with a maximum spacing of _______ inches on center.
Collar ties shall be a minimum of 1 inch by 4 inches, spaced not more than _______ feet on center.
Attic ventilation openings shall have a least dimension of _______ inch minimum and ________ inch maximum.
Attic access rough-framed openings shall be not less than _______ inches by _______ inches.
Except for Type IC luminaires, thermal insulation shall not be installed above a recessed luminaire or within _______ inches of the recessed luminaire's enclosure.
A cricket or saddle shall be installed on the ridge side of any chimney more than _______ inches wide as measured perpendicular to the slope.
Where the roof sheathing is less than _______ inch thick, the fasteners for asphalt shingles shall penetrate through the sheathing.
Asphalt shingles shall be secured to the roof with less than _________ fasteners per strip shingle or ___________ fasteners per individual shingle.
At the intersection of asphalt shingles with a vertical sidewall, flashing shall be a minimum of _______ inches in height and ________ inches in width.
Roof drip edges shall be mechanically fastened to the roof deck at a maximum of _________ inches on center.
Wood shakes shall only be used on slopes of _______ units vertical in ________ units horizontal or greater.
For wood shakes roofs, valley flashing shall be not less than No. _________ gage corrosion-resistant sheet metal.
Masonry chimney walls or chimney flue linings shall not chnage in size or shape within _______ inches above or below where the chimney passes through floor, ceiling or roof components.
Chimneys shall extend at least _______ feet higher than any portion of a building widthin ________ feet.
Masonry chimney walls shall be constructed of solid masonry units or hollow masonry units grouted solid with less than a ________ inch nomial thickness.
Any portion of a masonry chimney located in the interior of a building or widthin an exterior wall shall have a minimum airspace clearance to combustibles of _______ inches.
Exterior masonry chimneys that pass through a soffit or cornice shall have a minimum airspace clearance of __________ inch.
Footings for masonry chimneys shall be constructed of concrete or solid masonry at least _______ inches thick.
The minimum thickness of masonry fireplace hearths shall be _______ inches.
Where a masonry fireplace opening is less than 6 quare feet, hearth extensions shall extend at least _______ inches in front of and at least ______ inches beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
For masonry fireplace openings 6 square feet or larger, hearth extensions shall extend at least _______ inches in front of and at least _______ inches beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
All wood beams, joists, studs and other combustible material shall have a clearance of not less than ________ inches from the front faces and sides of masonry fireplaces.
Combustible material within ________ inches of the fireplace opening shall not project more than 1/8 inch for each 1-inch distance from such an opening.
Chapter 11 regulates the _______ efficiency for the desing and contruction of building regulated by this code.
For mechanical systems, a level working space at least _______ inches deep and _______ inches wide shall be provided in front of the control side to service an appliance.
Where mechanical equipment is located in attics, it shall not be farther than _______ feet from the attic access.
Attics containing mechanical appliances shall be provided with an opening and a clear and unobstructed passageway to allow removal of the ________ appliance.
Mechanical appliances installed in attics shall have a luminaire controlled by a switch located at the required ______ ______ and a receptacle outlet provided at or near the appliance location.
Mechanical appliances suspended from the floor shall have a clearance of not less than ________ inches from the ground.
Mechanical appliances having an ignition source shall be elevated such that the source of ignition is not less than ______ inches above the floor in garages.
_________ shall not be installed at the termination of a clothes dryer exhaust duct.
Clothes dryer exhaust ducts shall not be ______ inches nominal in diameter.
A 4-inch radius mitered 45-degree elbow dryer exhuast duct fitting shall reduce the maximum 35-foot length of dryer duct by _______ feet ________ inches.
Where space for a ________ ________ is provided, an exhaust duct system shall be installed.
Crimp joints for round and oval metal ducts shall be lapped not less than ______ inch(es).
Under-floor plenums shall be _______ in new structures.
Return air for a forced-air heating or cooling system shall not be taken from ________.
For mechanical system installations in flood hazard areas, _______ ________ openings shall be located at or above the required elevation.

For gas appliance installations using the two-permanent-openings method for outdoor combustion air, one opening shall be within ______ inches of the top and one within _______ inches of the bottom of the space.
Manually operated vent _______ shall not be installed except in connectors or chimneys serving solid fuel-burning appliances.
Freestanding or built-in ranges shall have a vertical clearance above the cooking top of not less than ________ inches to unprotected combustible material.
Sauna heaters shall be equipped with a thermostat that will limit room temperature to not greater than _______ degrees Fahrenheit.
Boiler pressure relief valve discharge shall be piped to drains by gravity to within _______ inches of the floor or to an open receptor.
Polyethylene tubing for hydronic piping system shall be installed with _______ - _______ joints.
The maximum amount of fuel oil stored above ground or inside a building shall be __________ gallons.
Vent piping on oil tanks shall be not smaller than _______ - inch pipe.
Oil tank vent piping shall terminate outside of buildings at a point not less than _______ feet, measured vertically or horizontally, from any building opening.
Components of a solar thermal energy system that might be subject to a vacuum during operation or shutdown shall be protected by _______ ________ _________ unless designed to withstand such a vacuum.
BTU is the abbreviation for ________ _________ _________, which is the quantity of heat required to raise the temperature of 1 pout of water 1 degree Fahrenheit.
Fuel gas piping installed across roof surfaces shall be elevated not less than _______ inches above the roof surface.
Where gas piping is concealed and run within _________ inches from the framing member face to which the membranes will be attached, it shall be protected by shield plates.
Shield plates, where required to cover the area of concealed gas piping, shall be a minimum No. __________ gage.
Underground fuel gas piping systems shall be installed a minimum depth of ______ inches below grade.
Gas appliance shutoff valves shall be located in the same room as the appliance and not farther than _________ feet from the appliance.
Fuel gas appliance connectors shall not exceed an overall length of _______ feet.
Gas vents over 12 inches in size shall terminate not less than ________ feet above the highest point where they pass through the roof.
A Type B or Type L gass vent shall terminate at least ________ feet vertical height above the highest connected appliance draft hood or flue collar.
A Type B-W gas vent shall terminate at least _______ feet in vertical height above the bottom of a wall furnace.
Vent connectors for draft-hood-equipped appliances shall not be _______ than the draft hood outlet diameter.
The lowest portion of a gas floor furnace shall have not less than a ________-inch clearance from grade level.
What size diameter is required for fuel-gas-fired domestic clothes dryer exhaust ducts?
Domestic clothes dryer transition ducts shall be metal and limited to a single length not to exceed _______ feet.
When doing a water test on DWV systems during rough-in plumbing, each section shall be filled with water to a point not less than _________ feet above the highest fitting in that section.
When doing an air test on DWV systems during rough-in plumbing, the portion under test shall be maintained at ________ psi for _________ minutes.
Water service pipe shall be installed not less than _______ inches deep and not less than _________ inches below the frost line.
Trenching installed parallel to footings shall not extend below the ________ - degree bearing plane of the bottom edge of a wall or footing.
In plumbing systems, supports for 1-inch copper or copper alloy tubing run horizontal shall not be spaced more than ________ feet apart.
Fixture tail pieces shall be not less than _______ inches in diameter for sinks, dishwashers, laundry tubs, bathtubs and similar fixtures.
The center line of water closets or bidets shall not be set less than _______ inches from adjacent side walls or partitions.
There shall be at least ________ inches of clearance in front of the water closet, bidet, or lavatory to any wall, fixture or door.
Standpipes shall extend a minimum of ________ inches and a maximum of _______ inches above the trap weir.
Shower compartments shall have at least ________ square inches of interior cross-sectional area.
Lavatories shall have waste outlets not less than ________ inches in diameter.
Bathtubs shall be equipped with waste outlets and overflow outlets connected to piping at least ________ inches in diameter.
Sinks shall be provided with waste outlets not less than _______ inches in diameter.
Each compartment of a laundry tub shall be provided with a waste outlet not less than _______ inches in diameter.
Floor drains shall have waste outlets not less than _______ inches in diameter and a removable strainer.
Bottom fed tank-type water heaters and bottom fed tanks connected to water heaters shall have a ______ ______ valve installed.
The maximum static pressure of a water service shall be ________ psi.
The minimum size water service pipe shall be ________ inch.
A _______ - __________ fire sprinkler system shall be seperate and independent from the water distribution system.
The fire sprinkler water supply shall provide the required design flow rate for ________ minutes for one-story dwelling units less than ________ square feet in area.
Where chlorine is used for disinfection in nonpotable water systems, the water shall contain not more than ________ ppm of chloramines or free chlorine.
The drainage fixture unit (d.f.u.) value of a dishwasher is __________.
Any combination of fixtures within two bathroom groups located on the same floor level are __________ to be vented by a horizontal wet vent.
Storm drainage sump pumps shall be of a capacity and head appropriate to _________ use requirements.
Electrical services within the scope of the IRC are limited to _________ volt, 0- to ________ -ampere, single-phase systems.
The markings for identification of disconnecting means shall have the durability to withstand the _________ involved.
Electrical panelboards and overcurrent devices shall not be located in __________.
Connected to establish electrical continuity and conductivity.
Overhead service-drop conductors shall have a vertical clearance of not less than _______ feet above the roof surface.
Over residential property and driveways, service-drop conductors shall have _________ feet minimum clearance above final grade.
In no case shall the point of attachment for service-drop conductors be less than _______ feet above finished grade.
Above-ground service-entrance cables subject to physical damage shall be protected by Schedule ___________ PVC conduit
Interior metal water piping located more than ________ feet from the point of entrance to the building shall not be used to connect electrodes as part of the grounding electrode system.
Rod an pipe electrodes shall be not less than _________ feet in length.
Bonding shall be provided where necessary to ensure electrical __________.
All mechanical elements used to terminate a grounding electrode conductor or bonding jumper to the grounding electrodes shall be __________.
Where a branch circuit or feeder supplies a continuous load, it shall have an ampacity of at least the noncontinuous load plus ________ percent of continuous load.
The rating of any one cord-and-plug-connected utilization equipment shall not exceed ________ percent of the branch-circuit ampere rating.
Branch circuit ratings for space-heating and water-heating appliances shall be considered ________ loads.

A minimum of ____________ 20-ampere-rated branch circuits shall be provided to serve all wall and floor receptacle outlets located in the kitchen, pantry, breakfast area, dining area or similar area of a dwelling.
A minimum of one ________-ampere-rated branch circuit shall be provided for receptacles located in the laundry area and shall serve only receptacle outlets in the laundry area.
A minimum of ___________ 20-ampere rated branch circuit(s) shall be provided to supply the bathroom receptacle outlet(s). Such circuits shall have no other outlets.
Conductors in NM cable assemblies shall be rated at _________ degrees Celsius.
Insulated conductors and cables exposed to direct rays of the sun shall be listed and labeled as ________ _________.
Where raceways are installed in wet locations above grade, the interior of such raceways shall be considered to be a ________ location.
Underground service laterals that are not encased in concrete and that are buried 18 inches or more below grade shall have their location identified by a _______ _________.
Receptacles shall be installed so that no point along the floor line in any wall space is more than _______ feet, measured horizontally, from an outlet in that space.
Kitchen wall countertop and work surface receptacles shall be installed so that no point along the wall line is more than ________ inches from a receptacle.
At least one receptacle outlet in bathrooms is required to be within _______ inches of the outside edge of each lavatory basin.
There shall be a wall switch at each floor to control stairway lighting where the stairway has _________ or more risers.
Nonmetallic boxes shall be used only with cabled wiring methods with entirely nonmetallic sheaths, flexible cords and nonmetallic raceways.
In calculating box fill, each No. 12 AWG conductor shall require _________ cubic inches of free space within the box.
Unused openings in cabinets and panelboards shall be effectively _________ to afford protection equivalent to that of the wall of the cabinet.
The _________ shall not be considered as an effective ground-fault current path.
Switches for devices and luminaires shall not be more than ________ feet ______ inches above the floor or working platform when the switch is in its highest position.
Receptacles installed on 15- and 20- ampere-rated branch circuits shall be of the ______ type.
Recessed incadescent fixtures shall have ________ protection.
In clothes closets, surface-mounted incandescent luminaires shall have ________ inches of minimum clearance from the nearest point of a storage space.
A luminaire that weighs more than _______ pounds or exceeds 16 inches in any dimension shall not be supported by the screw shell of a lampholder.
Flexible cords for kitchen range hoods shall be _______ inches minimum and ________ inches maximum length.
Ceiling-suspended paddle fans shall be supported ___________ of an outlet box.
Cords that supply swimming pool equipment shall have a copper equipment grounding conductor not smaller than No. _________ AWG.
